meanings.definition: The provision of care and support for individuals throughout their entire life.
meanings.sent1: The lifecare provided by the nursing home ensured the residents had everything they needed from birth to old age.
meanings.sent2: The lifecare center offered services that supported people at all stages of life.
meanings.sent3: The lifecare program made sure people were taken care of from the cradle to the grave.
meanings.sent4: The lifecare services acted as a safety net, embracing individuals from start to finish.
meanings.sent5: The lifecare concept painted a picture of continuous support and assistance throughout life.

meanings.definition: A facility or community that offers a range of services and amenities for residents at different stages of life.
meanings.sent1: The lifecare community provided a variety of services for residents at every age.
meanings.sent2: Living in a lifecare facility meant having access to different amenities based on one's life stage.
meanings.sent3: The lifecare center was like a one-stop shop for all your needs from cradle to grave.
meanings.sent4: The lifecare village was a hub of activities catering to individuals at various life points.
meanings.sent5: Choosing a lifecare community meant embracing a lifestyle that evolves with you as you age.
